metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1000033 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Shotwell version 0.22.0 (and possibly other versions) is vulnerable to a TLS/SSL certification validation flaw resulting in a potential for man in the middle attacks.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this is due to using webkit1, no fix available without switching to webkit2 which is not in trusty.

criterions.comment: shotwell: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
